title: Biden to sign gay marriage bill at White House ceremony
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden is inviting thousands to celebrate at the White House on Tuesday as he signs into law gay marriage legislation before a bipartisan crowd that reflects growing acceptance of same-sex unions.

title: Nancy Pelosi’s career chronicled in new film by her daughter
shortDescription: NEW YORK (AP) — For Alexandra Pelosi, the brutal attack on her father earlier this year was a culmination of vitriol that had been building for decades.

title: China casts long shadow over US-Africa Leaders Summit
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — With dozens of African leaders descending on Washington this week, the Biden administration is offering a not-so-subtle pitch in its economic competition with China on the continent: The U.S.

title: Young voters’ enthusiasm for Democrats waned during midterms
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Young voters who have been critical to Democratic successes in recent elections showed signs in November's midterms that their enthusiasm may be waning, a potential warning sign for a party that will need their strong backing heading into the 2024 presidential race.

title: Supreme Court won’t block California flavored tobacco ban
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court on Monday refused a request from tobacco companies to stop California from enforcing a ban on flavored tobacco products that was overwhelmingly approved by voters in November.

title: Congress eyes one week of funding to avoid gov’t shutdown
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Lawmakers should be prepared to act quickly to pass a resolution funding the federal government for one week as negotiators continue to work on a longer-term spending bill, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said Monday.

title: Anger in rural areas fuels protests against Peru government
shortDescription: ANDAHUAYLAS, Peru (AP) — The anger of Peruvians against their government is nowhere more visible than in Andahuaylas, a remote rural Andean community where the poor have struggled for years and where voters' support helped elect now-ousted President Pedro Castillo, himself a peasant like them.

title: Recount confirms Lauren Boebert narrowly held her House seat
shortDescription: DENVER (AP) — An automatic recount confirmed Monday that Republican Rep. Lauren Boebert won her reelection bid against Democrat Adam Frisch. The nail-biter race showed the congresswoman's combative style is wearying voters in her conservative Colorado district.

title: Youngkin sets special election to fill Rep. McEachin’s seat
shortDescription: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) — Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin set a special election for Feb. 21 to fill the 4th Congressional District seat of the late Democratic Rep. A. Donald McEachin, as the field of candidates seeking the post grew on Monday.

title: Senators want answers in wake of AP’s prison investigations
shortDescription: The chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee said he plans to question the director of the federal Bureau of Prisons this week about an Associated Press investigation that found the agency has repeatedly promoted and continues to stand by a high-ranking official who beat Black inmates in the 1990s.

title: Trump probe subpoena served on Georgia secretary of state
shortDescription: ATLANTA (AP) — Nevada’s most populous county and Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger have received subpoenas related to special counsel Jack Smith’s investigation of former President Donald Trump, who focused strongly on the states as he sought to overturn his 2020 election loss.

title: Biden forms interagency group to draft antisemitism strategy
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Amid a surge in hateful rhetoric and violence, President Joe Biden on Monday formed a new interagency group to develop a national strategy to combat antisemitism, the White House announced.

title: Prosecutor: Oath Keepers saw Jan. 6 as ‘first battle’ in war
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Four Oath Keepers charged with plotting to stop the transfer of presidential power from Donald Trump to Joe Biden accepted an “invitation to sedition” issued by the far-right extremist group’s founder, a federal prosecutor said Monday at the start of a second trial for group leaders and members.

title: West Virginia health secretary Crouch to retire in December
shortDescription: CHARLESTON, W.Va. (AP) — West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources Cabinet Secretary Bill Crouch is retiring at the end of the year, Gov. Jim Justice said Monday. Dr. Jeffrey Coben will step in as interim secretary, the Republican governor announced.

title: US hits Zimbabwe president’s son with sanctions
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration on Monday slapped corruption sanctions on the son of Zimbabwe’s president as the U.S. prepares to host a major summit of African leaders in Washington.

title: Bidens spread holiday cheer at Toys for Tots event
shortDescription: ARLINGTON, Va. (AP) — President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden helped pack presents for children and encouraged holiday cheer as the White House marked the 75th anniversary of Toys for Tots at an event hosted by the U.S.

title: House panel OKs voting law rewrite, 60% ballot question
shortDescription: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — Over the strenuous objections of voting rights groups, Ohio House Republicans advanced two proposals Monday that would add a host of new restrictions to voting and place an issue on next year's ballot that calls for requiring a 60% supermajority to pass future constitutional amendments.

title: Biden restarts task force on immigrants’ success in US
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration is reinstating a task force that is aimed at helping immigrants and refugees integrate into the United States.The Task Force on New Americans will be run by the Domestic Policy Council and the focus will be workforce training, education and financial access as well as language learning and the health of immigrants who have green cards and other types of legal status, according to the White House.

title: Young voters’ enthusiasm for Democrats waned during midterms
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Young voters who have been critical to Democratic successes in recent elections showed signs in November’s midterms that their enthusiasm may be waning, a potential warning sign for a party that will need their strong backing heading into the 2024 presidential race.

title: Democratic lawmakers visit Havana, meet with Cuban president
shortDescription: HAVANA (AP) — A delegation of at least three U.S. lawmakers visited Havana and met with Cuba’s government this week, American and Cuban officials confirmed.Reps. James McGovern (D-MA), Mark Pocan (D-WI) and Troy Carter (D-LA) met with Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel, leaders in Cuba’s congress and its foreign minister, the U.S.

title: Crypto CEO testifies to Congress; disgraced exchange founder indicted: updates
shortDescription: New CEO John J. Ray of the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX testifies before a congressional panel. Indictment against Sam Bankman-Fried unsealed.

title: Trump in trouble: GOP support craters for a 2024 bid - Exclusive poll
shortDescription: Most Republican voters want Trump-ism but are no longer so enthusiastic about ex-President Donald Trump himself, a warning sign for his 2024 campaign.

title: Judge tosses Trump's lawsuit, ending special master review of Mar-a-Lago records
shortDescription: A federal judge dismissed Donald Trump's lawsuit seeking a special master review of documents seized at Mar-a-Lago, based on an appeals court order.

title: White House slams Marjorie Taylor Greene's 'abhorrent' Jan. 6 remarks
shortDescription: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., said if she and Steve Bannon had organized the Jan. 6 riot "we would have won" and "it would've been armed."

title: Sam Bankman-Fried, ex-crypto exchange CEO, to testify before Congress Tuesday
shortDescription: Sam Bankman-Fried oversaw the downfall of the FTX crypto exchange before resigning as CEO. The hearing Tuesday is at 10 a.m. EST.

title: Supreme Court to hear second case on Biden's student loan forgiveness
shortDescription: The latest emergency appeal from the Biden administration means there are now two separate cases on the loan forgiveness plan at the Supreme Court.

title: White House defends Brittney Griner swap with Russian arms dealer Bout
shortDescription: Brittney Griner returned to the United States after being detained in Russia since February. The White House is negotiating Paul Whelan's return.

title: Biden hopes to draw Africa closer during Washington summit despite China and Russia influence
shortDescription: President Biden would use the summit of African leaders to declare his support for adding the African Union as a permanent member of the G-20 nations.

title: Nonfatal opioid overdoses by state: White House launches new data map
shortDescription: The data dashboard on nonfatal opioid overdoses will target specific regions to help fight the epidemic, which left 81,000 dead in the US this year.

title: Did Georgia voting law affect midterm election turnout? It's not clear.
shortDescription: Civil rights groups said Georgia's new voting laws passed by the GOP-controlled legislature amounted to suppression, even as voter turnout peaked.

title: Democrats in 'tight spot' after Sinema's departure from national party
shortDescription: Political experts told USA TODAY that Sinema's move complicates Democrats' ability to hold onto the Arizona Senate seat, and Senate control, in 2024.

title: Supreme Court to hear First Amendment case on immigration fraud
shortDescription: The case arrives at the Supreme Court two years after the justices settled a similar dispute over the immigration law on procedural grounds.

title: Incoming member of Congress denied for DC apartment
shortDescription: Maxwell Frost made history as the first member of Gen Z to be elected to Congress.  That didn’t help him get an apartment in the nation’s capital.

title: What Sinema's announcement and Warnock's win mean for the Senate
shortDescription: Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock won a Georgia Senate runoff Tuesday. Days later, Arizona's Kyrsten Sinema said she was leaving the Democratic Party.

title: Colorado Third Congressional District Election Results
shortDescription: See full results and maps from the 2022 Colorado elections.

title: Senate Report Finds Widespread Sexual Abuse of Women in Federal Prisons
shortDescription: Federal Bureau of Prisons employees have abused female inmates in at least 19 of the 29 federal facilities that have held women over the past decade, the report says.By Glenn Thrush

title: Lauren Boebert, Far-Right Firebrand, Wins Re-election After Recount
shortDescription: Ms. Boebert defeated Adam Frisch in Colorado’s Republican-leaning Third District to win a second term in the House.By Jazmine Ulloa and Neil Vigdor

title: Two Decades After 9/11 Inquiry, a Similar Plan for Covid Stalls in Congress
shortDescription: The 9/11 Commission prompted a national reckoning over the Sept. 11 attacks. But some experts fear that the chance to create an independent panel to investigate the pandemic response is slipping away.By Sheryl Gay Stolberg

title: Alexandra Pelosi on Filming Her Mother, Nancy Pelosi, During the Jan. 6 Attack
shortDescription: The documentary had long been in the works and was nearly finished before Paul Pelosi was assaulted at home. The events together have left the director shaken.By Melena Ryzik

title: Indian Country Needs Money to Protect Its Wildlife Heritage. Congress Must Help.
shortDescription: Losses of animals and plants represent a fundamental threat to how Native peoples practice their religions and pass on their cultures.By Gloria Tom

title: Dems agonize over Sinema 2024
shortDescription: If the newly minted Arizona independent seeks reelection, she could set up a three-way race that puts her former party in a perilous position in a swing state.
